name: Commandos: Behind Enemy Lines
description: Commandos: Behind Enemy Lines is a real-time tactics game set in World War II that puts you in command of a small squad of elite troopers. Send them behind enemy lines on a series of hazardous missions, and bring them back alive. Clever strategy has never been so furiously action-packed.
minimum_requirements: IBM PC or 100% compatible, Windows 9X/ME, Pentium II 300 MHz (or equivalent), 64 MB RAM, 100% DirectX® 8 compatible 3D Accelerator card with at least 12 MB VRAM, 100% DirectX® 8 compatible (or higher) Sound card, DirectX® 8 (DirectX 8.0a included), 2 GB uncompressed hard drive space, 100% Windows 95/98 compatible Keyboard and Mouse Recommended: Pentium II 450 MHz, Windows 98SE/ME, 128 MB RAM, 100% DirectX® 8 compatible 3D Accelerator card with 32 MB VRAM, 3 GB uncompressed hard drive space

reviews.review_text: Old? No, it is classic.

When I was a child,I loved this game. Still,I LOVE it.  I saw many complaints about the super speed. Luckily I solved it by myslef. It seems like steam released a patch to solve this issue 1 month ago.

One of the best games I'd played as a kid. Thought of buying the game and supporting the team and ended up playing once more. Still a great game to play. For those interested in strategy, achieving objectives and killing every last enemy on the map just for the fun of it; highly recommended!   Its a true classic!  The graphics arent' that great anymore but still is immersive enough in my opinion. No bugs or issues to report.

This is one of those games that every gamer should have in their collection. I've played it for the first time when it came out in 98 and it blew me away. Looking for a masterpiece? Look no further! And it's even cheap!  I wish someone could bring the series back to life.

An old game about the WWII, where tactics, sabotage and destruction are all part of your plan. Very technical and challenging, more sort of a thinking game then a shoot 'em up. The English could do with some minor adjustments.

This game is a blast! I'm very glad to see it on steam. This game requires more patience than I had when i played it 15 years ago. My tips are: read the F1 help menu in game and learn the keyboard shortcuts/commands. My other tip is, make sure you use multiple saves! This game makes you feel like a boss everytime you beat a level.  The only thing it stuffers from is a slightly outdated ui. It would be nice for the game to display the keyboard commands on the game screen rather than in an F1 menu. The amount of keyboard shortcuts is out of the realm of fast memorization. I actually took a pad of paper and just wrote down the keyboard shortcuts. This is only a problem because as a digital download you dont have the benefit of a nice printed user manual in front of you; something that this game originaly came with. Other than that this game is a must play for any methodical/stealth RTS fans. Works great on my win7 pc.
The game is amazing. Played it alot when I was younger.

This game is great fun and worth your money. Definitely one of the memorable classics. Played it a lot when I was younger, but never finished it.  Developers updated it recently to fix bugs for modern machine compatibility.

I originally played this game in what seemed like a different life; back in 1998 when it came out. I remember spending countless hours playing this game, and I remember it being incredibly difficult but loads of fun. It is very reminiscent of other strategy games of the mid-late nineties, but set in World War II.   You command a group of commandos, all with different skills and abilities. Each stage has different line-ups of soldiers and usually a different inventory. The spy can disguise himself as a Nazi captain, the Marine can dive underwater and commandeer an inflatable raft, the driver can control tanks, the sapper can place bombs and traps, etc. Some characters run faster, and only some characters can heal.   I will say, if you are looking for an easy play through and/or get easily frustrated, this game is NOT for you. It is very challenging and you die almost immediately if you are caught. You will find yourself constantly saving and loading, and I found it not uncommon to save/load around fifty times a map. It is stealth based and you will die if you go in guns blazing. Don't let this discourage you though, since it's a very fun game and gave me countless hours of entertainment.   When I bought this game here on Steam it was something stupid-cheap like 75 cents. Even if you only play a map or two, you get your money's worth to at least give it a try. It is of course heavily dated (I almost laughed when I saw the system requirements), but the value and fun is there. Give it a shot, you won't regret it.
Old but really good game!
Still good even after playing it for the 100th time.
One of the best world war games of all time, hands down!

You must have the skill of a highly trained royal commando in order to use these controls, and possess the patience of a saint to plan out your route through enemy patrols. Brilliant stealth system, your commandos can even be captured and rescued in a mission. No windowed mode.

This game runs too fast on modern hardware. I can only find old outdated posts on the Steam forums by users that made fixes, but all the sharing site links are down and no longer working. THE GAME DOES NOT WORK STOCK ON STEAM. How they get away with reselling this garbage that plain doesn't work is beyond me. I've also read that these versions are 1.0, not even patched to the latest versions.  Once you get it working, if you do, the controls are god awful. You have to literally memorize 10 different hotkeys for each soldier. Unlike most RTS games, where if you click an attack on an enemy, your unit will close into range and attack. Not here. In this crappy game they stand there like idiots until you tell them to move with a hotkey, and then tell them to attack with another hotkey. By then they're dead. I don't care if it's an old game. I recall getting a demo on an old PC Gamer disc, and there were tons of RTS games like Command & Conquer out by then. Whomever designed the UI in this game needs to be shot. This game was originally released in 1998, so there's no ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ excuse for this. There is waaaaay too much micro management here for an RTS to where you were wishing it was either turn-based, or the controls were consolidated enough to where your unit weren't so worthless.  I guess after I fixed the speed as well as the saved games not working I now get to try to find something that will bind custom hotkeys.   Do not waste your dollar on this garbage because the time spent to get it all working will cost you more in the end.
Old but gold! I can't forget that game.
Nostalgia trip. However best left as a memory of a great past
Old EPIC game, you will love it!

I love that this game is real-time 'tactics' and not strategy. It's got the feel of a strategy game without the complexity of micro-management. The variety of different tactics that you can use on each map make this game feel incredibly deep and well thought out. Despite its age, the game play is highly enjoyable and fans of 2D isometric maps will find that the landscapes and units are still well detailed and crisp, even at the low resolutions the game offers.

If you have a newer PC, don't bother with this game. I was able to run Commandos 3 After excruciating hours of trying to run it on Windows 7. After the free upgrade to Windows 10 and subsequent updates, I could no longer get this thing working. I finally gave up all hope of ever being able to play this game.  Those with newer operating systems or maybe PCs should steer clear of this. It's a waste of time. If only I had a time machine to just finish one of my favorite games of the late 90s.

The Commando series are not what we typically think of as a strategy game today. They are part of an older action genre that luckily died out in favor of better RTS games. Basically in Commandos there is only one way to perform the mission and you have to look around and do a lot of trial and error, read that as dying over and over again, to try different things at various times in order to progress. I was looking for something along the lines of Rush To Berlin or something similar and this is a far cry from that masterpiece. Unless you enjoy frustration or have unending patience, I would not reccommend the Commando series for someone looking for a 'real' strategy game.

This game was great when it was new and I spent long hours getting caught and shot on sight by nazis.  But it was worth it to feel the thrill of sneaking behind a guard with clockwork precision.  Now, it feels a bit old. Maybe because the puzzles are pretty straightforward so once you know how to solve them there is not much challenge or replayability.  Characters are not that well balanced, you can do almost anything just using the green beret so everyone else has a specific purpose on the mission and little more use.
A good old RTS that rewards patience and trial & error. Lots of it.

The Commandos franchise is best known for the group of, get this, commandos at your disposal. Your Green Beret can carry heavy items. Your Sapper can plant explosives and destroy military structures. Your Sniper can (get this (yes, again)) snipe etc. You'll have to learn your team's strengths and weaknesses in order to beat it's crushingly difficult missions against the Nazi war machine. 'Commandos: Behind Enemy Lines's extreme difficulty and character variants make for a superb strategic experience.
A memorable game of my childhood ~ xD~
Great old school stealth game, would recommend the series.
Classic .

If one of your friends has ANY knowledge on how to port forward, this game is a MUST play on multiplayer. Engaging missions and an extremely small margin for error makes this game what it is. While the graphics may be lacking and the controls are tough to get used to, the gameplay is a very fun experience and successfully pulling off a tough mission is very rewarding. However, the game does get somewhat dificult at times, and very small mistakes can undo a good amount of work.  7/10

Classic!
♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hard. You will be using the Save feature a lot. Fun, clever, but very old and it shows. Incredible value for money, but you will need the patience of a saint to get through it all.
Brings back the old memories and it's still a good game - had no issues running it on Windows 7 without any 3rd party patches.
A classic. Very simple graphics, easy controls and a ton of missions. Easy to learn, hard to master.
Best game of my childhood and love <3 :') when i play it i remember the old days.

You'll control a bunch of allied commandos with horrible Spanish accents during their reckless and spontaneous attempts to defy the Third Reich.  Blowing up barrels couldn't be more exciting than this. You will also learn a lot of German.
This game tests your endurance in tapping Escape and clicking on Save Game over and over again.  19/41 would Save Game again.

You might have the same sort of nostalgia as I do about this game, but try to avoid it, it hasn't aged well. If it ever was good, that is; it's more of a puzzle game than anything else. There's one correct way of doing the various scenarios, and it's often illogical. You'll stab people, hide while their body is discovered (you won't have time to hide the body) and then come back to stab another. This is more or less how it goes, rather than any actual stealth approach, you find a guy you can kill, hide for a while, then kill another. Not terribly stimulating, even with nostalgia.
The mission preview, where your commanding officer walks you through the mission, does not work, so you don't know what to do.

Commandos is a good strategy game where you control a small squad of soldiers. It reminds Jagged Alliance 2 but works in real time, and you can't issue orders in pause. Usually you need to come to enemies from behind, learn their patrol routes, and track their fields of view which the game shows as green cones. The graphics were great for the time and have aged well. The sounds and the music are good. If you like a challenge than this game if for you. It's get's extremely hard fast. Too the point it can become frustrating, but you don't find that in game today, so I appreciate the challenge.

I would lie about hidden levels and special German weapons and just generally talk shti, he would get angry and flip the table over, and then get sent out of class to stand in the hall. Good times.

Spent 16 hours of playing so far, but it was enough to finish it. Probably for 100th time... One of the best games from my childhood!  I'm using Win7 and had no problems with running the game, except some old game bugs - lost sounds and getting dropped out of the game after too much load saves.
That's how you start a legendary series!

5/10 rating   I wouldn’t have recommended this game at all if it wasn’t for old memories playing this game as a kid back in the old days. But anyways this isn’t recommended for Windows 10 users because it lacks compatibility. It’s still a cool game and I’ll play it whenever it works.
